title: How to Make Austrian Sponge Cake with Cherries and Meringue

steps.headline: Separate the egg yolks from the egg whites.
Beat the yolks with sugar, oil and baking powder in a tall plastic container.
Beat the egg whites with a pinch of salt in another bowl.
steps.description: The whites should be beaten back so if the bowl is not overflowing.

steps.headline: Use a wooden spoon to gradually add the egg whites to the bowl with the egg yolks from top to bottom.
steps.description: Work slowly because whites lose volume.

steps.headline: Add the flour and mix it in gently with a wooden spoon.
Pour the mixture into a pan greased with oil and dusted with flour.
steps.description: You can pour it into a shaped pan.

steps.headline: Top the mixture with cherries dusted with a little flour.
Place the mixture in the oven over low heat for 25-30 minutes.
steps.description: Check it occasionally with a toothpick.

steps.headline: Make the meringue.
steps.description: You'll need 3 egg whites, 5 tbsp. sugar, and 2 tbsp. powdered sugar. To make it, all you have to do is beat the egg whites hard and then add the two types of sugar gradually and beat until the sugars have melted and the meringue is glossy.

steps.headline: When the cake has finished cooking, remove it from the oven and top it with the meringue.
Place it in the oven for another 15 minutes until it's browned on top.
Serve.
steps.description: Once your cake cools off a bit, it's ready to eat.

text: Separate the egg yolks from the egg whites.  Beat the yolks with sugar, oil and baking powder in a tall plastic container.  Beat the egg whites with a pinch of salt in another bowl. The whites should be beaten back so if the bowl is not overflowing. Use a wooden spoon to gradually add the egg whites to the bowl with the egg yolks from top to bottom. Work slowly because whites lose volume. Add the flour and mix it in gently with a wooden spoon.  Pour the mixture into a pan greased with oil and dusted with flour. You can pour it into a shaped pan. Top the mixture with cherries dusted with a little flour.  Place the mixture in the oven over low heat for 25-30 minutes. Check it occasionally with a toothpick. Make the meringue. You'll need 3 egg whites, 5 tbsp. sugar, and 2 tbsp. powdered sugar. To make it, all you have to do is beat the egg whites hard and then add the two types of sugar gradually and beat until the sugars have melted and the meringue is glossy. When the cake has finished cooking, remove it from the oven and top it with the meringue.  Place it in the oven for another 15 minutes until it's browned on top.  Serve. Once your cake cools off a bit, it's ready to eat.
